column1: The first identifiable civilization in Banat region were the Dacians who left traces of their past. Nearby archaeological finds indicate settlements of Neolithic and Roman origins. From coin finds

column1: Timișoara was first officially mentioned as a place in 1212 as the Roman castrum Temesiensis or Castrum regium Themes. The town was destroyed by the Tatars in the 13th century but Timișoara was rebuilt and grew considerably during the reign of Charles I of Hungary
column2: who
column3: upon his visit there in 1307
column4: ordered the fortress to be fortified with stone walls and to build a royal palace. Italian craftsmen and architects were used. He even moved the royal seat from Buda to Temesvár between 1315 and 1323. Timișoara's importance also grew due to its strategic location
column5: which facilitated control over the Banat plain. By the middle of the 14th century
column6: Timișoara was at the forefront of Western Christendom's battle against the Muslim Ottoman Turks. Crusaders met at the city before engaging in the Battle of Nicopolis in 1396. Beginning in 1443
column7: John Hunyadi used Timișoara as a military stronghold against the Turks
column8: having built a powerful fortress. The land of Banat was attacked by the Ottomans in 1462 and 1476
column9: and the city was repeatedly besieged by them in 1491 and finally in 1522.

column1: Timișoara lies at an altitude of 90 metres (300 feet) on the southeast edge of the Banat plain
column2: part of the Pannonian Plain near the divergence of the Timiș and Bega rivers. The waters of the two rivers form a swampy and frequently flooded land. Timișoara developed on one of few places where the swamps could be crossed. These constituted a natural protection around the fortress for a very long time
column3: however
column4: they also favoured a wet and insalubrious climate
column5: as well as the proliferation of the plague and cholera
column6: which kept the number of inhabitants at a relatively low number and significantly prevented the development of the city. With time
column8: the rivers of the area were drained
column9: dammed and diverted. Due to these hydrographical projects undertaken in the 18th century
column10: the city no longer lies on the river Timiș
column11: but on the Bega Canal. This improvement of the land was made irreversible by building the Bega Canal (started in 1728) and by the complete draining of the surrounding marshes. However
column12: the land across the city lies above a water table at a depth of only 0.5 to 5 metres (1.6–16.4 feet)
column13: a factor which does not allow the construction of tall buildings. The rich black soil and relatively high water table make this a fertile agricultural region.

column1: Climate in this area has mild differences between highs and lows
column2: and there is adequate rainfall year-round.  The Köppen Climate Classification subtype for this climate is "Cfb" (oceanic climate).The climate which defines Timișoara city is the oceanic climate (Köppen: Cfb) and can be regarded as humid continental (Dfb) when using an isotherm of 0 °C (32 °F). The city characterises the South-Eastern part of The Pannonian Basin.

column1: Snow stays on the ground 30 days a year on average

Lowest precipitation: February: 44.5 mm(1.737 in)Climatic general features consist of various and irregular weather conditions. The dominating temperate air masses during spring and summer are of oceanic origin and come with great precipitations. Frequently
column2: even during winter period
column3: the Atlantic humid air masses bring rainy and snowy weather
column4: rarely cold weather.

column2: frequent continental polar air masses coming from the East invade the area. In spite of all that
column3: the Banat climate is also influenced by the presence of cyclones and warm air masses which come from the Mediterranean. Their characteristic feature is that of complete snow thaw during the winter period and stifling heat during the summer period.

column1: Freak measurable snowfalls have occurred as early as late October and as late as early April
column2: but snow in those months is rare
column3: and significant falls do not usually occur until first of November. The median date for the first freeze is 22 October
column4: while that of the last freeze is 15 April.
